div.head: ILLVSTRI ET GENEROSO D. D. GEORGIO BVCKINGHAMO viro familiâ & virtute nobili.

lg.l: INgenium, virtus, probitas, & forma decora,
Seu placeat verae Nobilitatis honos.
BVCKINGHAMVS adest, qui cuncta haec possidet vnu • ,
En, facies certis iudicat ipsa notis.
O nimium foelix, ô fausta sorte creatum,
Cui tam constanter, sors magis aequa fluit?
Hane DEVS omnipotens dedit & Natura, GEORGI,
Firmauit magni mox tibi REGIS amor.
Quem tua promeruit virtus & gratia 〈◊〉
Opto tibi REX hunc continuare velit.

lg.head: The same in English.
lg.l: WIt, vertue, beauty, sincere honesty,
True reall badges of nobilitie.
All met in One, to make a man of Fame
All shining bright in noble BVCKLNGHAM:
O happy, ô thrice happy by blest Fate,
Whose starres, his honors, thus accumulate.
GOD and the KING, yea Nature, all concurre,
To grace great George with Honors golden-spurre.
O, neuer may thy King, to loue thee, cease,
But thy rare parts, his hearts true loue encrease.
